xxl.core.predicates

Class MultiFeaturePredicate<P,R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.predicates.AbstractPredicate<P>
      • xxl.core.predicates.MultiFeaturePredicate<P,R>
  • Type Parameters:
    P - the type of the predicate's parameters.
    R - the type of the underlying predicate's parameters (the return type of the mapping functions).
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Predicate<P>

    public class MultiFeaturePredicate<P,R>
extends AbstractPredicate<P>
    This class provides a decorator predicate that applies a fixed number number of mapping functions to the arguments of the underlying predicate. Everytime arguments are passed to an invoke method of this class, the arguments are seperately mapped using a given mapping functions and afterwards passed to the invoke method of the underlying predicate.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Function<? super P,? extends R>[] mappings
      An array of mapping functions that are applied to the arguments of this predicate's invoke methods before the invoke method of the underlying predicate is called.
      protected Predicate<? super R> predicate
      A reference to the predicate to be decorated.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MultiFeaturePredicate(Predicate<? super R> predicate, Function<? super P,? extends R>... mappings)
      Creates a new feature predicate that separately applies the specified mapping functions to the arguments of it's invoke methods before the invoke method of the given predicate is called.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean invoke(List<? extends P> arguments)
      Returns the result of the predicate as a primitive boolean value.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • predicate

        protected Predicate<? super R> predicate
        A reference to the predicate to be decorated. This reference is used to perform method calls on the underlying predicate.

      • mappings

        protected Function<? super P,? extends R>[] mappings
        An array of mapping functions that are applied to the arguments of this predicate's invoke methods before the invoke method of the underlying predicate is called.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiFeaturePredicate

        public MultiFeaturePredicate(Predicate<? super R> predicate,
                             Function<? super P,? extends R>... mappings)
        Creates a new feature predicate that separately applies the specified mapping functions to the arguments of it's invoke methods before the invoke method of the given predicate is called.
        Parameters:
        predicate - the predicate which input arguments should be mapped.
        mappings - the mapping functions that are applied to the arguments of the wrapped predicate.

    • Method Detail

      • invoke

        public boolean invoke(List<? extends P> arguments)
        Returns the result of the predicate as a primitive boolean value. The mapped arguments of this method are passed to the underlying predicate's invoke method.
        Specified by:
        invoke in interface Predicate<P>
        Overrides:
        invoke in class AbstractPredicate<P>
        Parameters:
        arguments - the arguments to the predicate.
        Returns:
        the result of the predicate as a primitive boolean value.
